name: Linkup
description: Linkup is a web application that allows users to create an online hub for multiple links to their content and social profiles, so their audience can easily find all of their content. The app allows for customization, giving users the ability to personalize their space so it matches their brand.
label: Link Sharing Simplified!

study.heading: Linkup
study.about: Linkup is a web application that allows users to create an online hub for multiple links to their content and social profiles, so their audience can easily find all of their content. The app allows for customization, giving users the ability to personalize their space so it matches their brand.
study.process: I began the project by designing and prototyping a fully responsive user interface in Adobe XD. I used React and additional modules such as Styled Components and React Router to develop the UI & UX. Firebase was used for the backend processes, including authorization, database, and storage.

name: Winnipeg Transit Live
description: Winnipeg Transit Live is an application dedicated to making commuting through Winnipeg Transit as seamless as possible. With live updates and a simple interface, Winnipeg Transit Live provides all of the functionality necessary for a complete and successful commute. Whether you are waiting for a bus or looking to check route information, Winnipeg Transit Live has everything you need!
label: Realtime Bus Times!

study.heading: Winnipeg Transit Live
study.about: Winnipeg Transit Live is built using React and Ionic to consume Winnipeg Transits real-time data. The app is a centralized location where users can find a list of bus stops in their current surrounding area. The user can tap on the bus stop they wish to see the next scheduled arrivals for to be navigated to a page which contains all the routes that pass by this location.
study.process: I started a wireframe for the app, revised it using Figma. I got familiar with Winnipeg Transit's API and then proceeded to build the UI with React, Ionic, and Sass. I implemented Google AdMob for iOS and Android, deployed it in app stores, and served it as a progressive web app on a dedicated domain.

name: Stoic Widgets
description: Stoic Widgets is an iOS 14 widget app that pushes stoic wisdom to your lock screen every day. Here, you will find quotes from Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, Stoic Philosopher Seneca, Epictetus, and others. These quotes are selected ahead of time to strike a balance between fun, humor and wisdom.
label: iOS Widget

study.heading: Stoic Widgets
study.about: Stoic Widgets is an iOS 14 widget app that pushes stoic wisdom to your lock screen every day. Here, you will find quotes from Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius, Stoic Philosopher Seneca, Epictetus, and others. These quotes are selected ahead of time to strike a balance between fun, humor and wisdom.
study.process: I designed the UI of Stoic widgets using Figma. I then moved to create the host app using React Native, Styled Components, and React Navigation. Once the host app was ready, I started creating iOS widgets using Swift and Widget Kit. I integrated the app Firebase and Microsoft App Center for updating home feed content and the app itself.
